title: Integrated Computer-Based and Hands-On Learning Design for Understanding Electrical Circuits

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic electrical concepts (current, voltage, resistance)
context.additional_context: A non-real-time online self-directed learning program for working professionals, combining computer simulations and offline practical activities using personal devices, with collaborative learning encouraged through small group activities

learning_goals: Explain the functions of basic components in an electrical circuit (light bulb, battery, switch, etc.) and interpret circuit diagrams.
Apply Ohm’s Law to calculate voltage, current, and resistance in simple series/parallel circuits.
Design virtual circuit experiments and analyze results using computer simulation tools (e.g., PhET Circuit Construction Kit).

Learners will design three or more circuits (e.g., series/parallel circuits, LED blinking circuits) using physical components like breadboards, resistors, and LEDs, verify that oscilloscope-measured voltage/current values align within ±10% of theoretical calculations, and document a systematic resolution of at least two errors in a report.
Present job-related applications of electrical safety based on learned content.

resources: LMS Platform (with Video, Quiz, and Forum Features)
Virtual Lab Tools (e.g., PhET Circuit Construction Kit)
Individual Practice Kit (Breadboard, Wires, Resistors, LEDs, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
